item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
1st and 3rd pics are not unusual. You often see similar output with Qubes package updates.

2nd pic is a known issue that is fixed in Whonix 14. See:

https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/3469

It is not fatal to anonymity. If you run:

systemctl status systemd-timesyncd.service

You will see the process is dead ->

user@host:~$ systemctl status systemd-timesyncd.service
● systemd-timesyncd.service - Network Time Synchronization
Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-timesyncd.service; enabled)
Drop-In: /lib/systemd/system/systemd-timesyncd.service.d
└─30_qubes.conf, 40_sdwdate.conf
Active: inactive (dead)
Docs: man:systemd-timesyncd.service(8)

@Patrick that error message link above to “whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Design-Shared#timezone” is broken because it doesn’t exist on that wiki page.

PS Jessie is EOL as of 17 June, so I guess we don’t have long to wait for Whonix 14 ->

https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4205

Your earlier pics re: Fedora 26 updates and checksums not matching is also not uncommon. As to why - I’m guessing it relates to issues Qubes have had recently re: changing Fedora repos to https, or possibly network attackers at large screwing with downloads over Tor (although I don’t see how it can succeed as an attack vector, if gpgcheck=1 is applied, which it is by default).

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Note:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#Am_I_Compromised.3F

Otherwise, this is up to Qubes support as per:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle

What to post in this Qubes-Whonix forum and what not. Qubes-Whonix
As a rule of thumb: Everything that happens “inside” the virtual machines is Qubes-Whonix and belongs into this sub forum. Everything that happens “outside” the virtual machine is Qubes and the Qubes help should be consulted. Some examples: EFI -> Qubes help Errors by by Qubes VM Manager (QVMM) -> Qubes help libvirtError -> Qubes help Issues that also apply to Debian based VMs. -> Qubes help error: Failed to save domain whonix-ws-dvm to /var/lib/qubes/appvms/whonix-ws-dvm/dvm-savefile …

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Don’t start Tor Browser in TemplateVM. This is at least what we write here:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser/Advanced_Users#Running_Tor_Browser_in_Qubes_TemplateVM

Open to reconsider.

Use https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Tor_Browser_Downloader_by_Whonix

This is not yet well thought through / let alone documented. TODO: development

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi whonixbest

Updating Tor Browser should be fairly simple

Edited as per Patrick’s followup post

1. In dom0, run Tor Browser in whonix-vm-dvm

2. In the upper left hand corner of Tor Browser, right-click the green onion.

3. Right-click on Check for Tor Browser updates

4. When updates are complete, restart Tor Browser when prompted

5. In dom0, shutdown whonix-vm-dvm

  1. In dom0, run whonix-vm-dvm konsole

    qvm-run whonix-vm-dvm konsole

  2. In whonix-vm-dvm konsole, update Tor Browser

    update-torbrowser

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi whonixbest

This following wiki page was written for Qubes 3.2 .

If you are using Qubes 4.0, you can disregard setting a NetVM for your template VMs. (Github Qubes issue 1854)

Whonix

Qubes/Update

How to update Qubes-Whonix.

There is also an issue with qubes-manager showing the pending updates available icon (green arrow) when no updates are available. If you have already updated Whonix templates, its most likely due to this bug.

https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/3743

https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/2009

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Known issue:

https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/3737

Fix:

Modify /etc/yum.repos.d/qubes-r4.repo to use https instead of http.

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi whonixbest

Since this issue in not Whonix specific you can use the Qubes mailing list to ask for help with updating Qubes (Fedora) templates.

Qubes OS

Help, Support, and Mailing Lists

Help, Support, and Mailing Lists Help and support for Qubes OS is available from the documentation and the mailing lists, which are explained below. The Qubes OS Project does not offer paid support services. Staying safe The Qubes mailing lists are...

If you do ask for help on the Qubes mailing list it may be helpful to:

  • translate the text in the Fedora terminal to english
  • mention if this is a new problem ( have you successfully updated this template previously?)
  • if you changed any network settings

Also, if you are updating over Tor? You may want to wait a while and try again.

Read full topic

item.title: problems update or hacked whonix-qubes 4.0
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi whonixbest

This is something that happens from time to time. The good news is, this doesn’t look like you’ve been hacked. Quite often this is something that resolves itself in time.

Taken from wiki Security_Guide

It could be a temporary Tor exit relay or server failure that should resolve itself. Check if the network connection is functional by changing the Tor circuit and trying again. Running whonixcheck might also help to diagnose the problem.

https://whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#Updates

Other considerations:

  • Have you successfully updated your R4.0 Whonix templates prior to this?

  • Did you change any network settings recently?

Read full topic
